register.description: This register contains the K3_DSS revision number
This register controls various parameters related to software reset and IP idle
This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information

bitfield.description: Reset status of DISPC Functional clock domain

register.description: RAW Interrupt status. Raw status is set even if interrupt is not enabled. Write 1 to set the RAW status

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ STATUS- Reserved for future use
Dummy IRQ STATUS- Reserved for future use

register.description: Interrupt status. Enabled status, isn't set unless event is enabled. Write 1 to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced. RAW status also gets cleared, i.e. even if not enabled

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ STATUS-Reserved for future use
Dummy IRQ STATUS-Reserved for future use

register.description: SET Interrupt enable. Write 1 to set interrupt enable. Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register

bitfield.description: WB IRQ, if WB pipeline is present

register.description: CLR Interrupt enable. Write 1 to clear interrupt enable

bitfield.description: WB IRQ, if WB pipeline is present
VID IRQ.[0] -&gt; VID1, [1] -&gt; VIDL1, [2] -&gt; VID2, [3] -&gt; VIDL2

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VP_0 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only

VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VP_0 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the WB internal sources of interrupt, if WB pipeline is present, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: The write back buffer has been flushed before been fully drained.

register.description: This register groups all the status of the WB internal events that generate an interrupt, if WB pipeline is present. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: Write back DMA buffer is flushed before been completely drained.
Write-back DMA Buffer Overflow The DMA buffer is full

register.description: End-Of-Interrupt register for FUNC interrupts, to be used if pulse interrupts are used The EOI register is used to re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal to ensure that any nested interrupt events are serviced. The software interrupt handler must write to the EOI register at the end of the current interrupt processing routine, so that new events can re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal again. For level interrupt signals the EOI register is not functional and must not be used.

bitfield.description: Write 1 to acknowledge a pulse IRQ

register.description: End-Of-Interrupt register for SAFETY interrupts, to be used if pulse interrupts are used The EOI register is used to re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal to ensure that any nested interrupt events are serviced. The software interrupt handler must write to the EOI register at the end of the current interrupt processing routine, so that new events can re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal again. For level interrupt signals the EOI register is not functional and must not be used.

bitfield.description: Write 1 to acknowledge a pulse IRQ

register.description: End-Of-Interrupt register for SECURITY interrupts, to be used if pulse interrupts are used The EOI register is used to re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal to ensure that any nested interrupt events are serviced. The software interrupt handler must write to the EOI register at the end of the current interrupt processing routine, so that new events can re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal again. For level interrupt signals the EOI register is not functional and must not be used.

bitfield.description: Write 1 to acknowledge a pulse IRQ

register.description: Disable security settings throughout DSS IP. COMMON_1.DISPC_SECURE bits are honoured only if COMMON. =0
MFLAG control register

DISPC global output enable register. The ENABLE or GO bit for a particular output port is set when either the corresponding bit in this register is set or the corresponding bit within the sub-module is set. This register allows enabling multiple outputs synchronously [simultaneously], which is not possible if the ENABLE/GO bits are present only within the sub-module

bitfield.description: Global GO Command for the VP

register.description: The register configures the DMA buffers allocations to the pipelines for DMA

bitfield.description: Controls if the DMA buffers are re-filled only when the LOW threshold is reached or if all DMA buffers are re-filled when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold
WB DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines, if WB pipeline is present
VIDL2 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines, if VIDL2 is present
VID2 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines, if VID2 is present
VIDL1 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines
VID1 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines

register.description: This register contains CBA specific config bits in DSS

bitfield.description: IP Internal - Tie-off value on DMA_BACKLOGSTATUS pins when DMA Backlog Status reporting is disabled
IP Internal - Disable generation of DMA Backlog Status reporting to interconnect
The value sent out on the PRI_HI bus from DSS to CBA Indicates the priority level for high-priority [MFLAG] transactions.
The value sent out on the PRI_LO bus from DSS to CBA Indicates the priority level for normal [non-MFLAG] transactions.

register.description: DISPC debug status control register

bitfield.description: Mux select for the debug status

register.description: DISPC debug status register
Register to control clock gating at DISPC sub-module level

bitfield.description: Clock gating control for WB, if WB pipeline is present

register.description: This register contains the FBDC Product Code
This register contains the FBDC Branch Code
This register contains the FBDC Version Code
This register contains the FBDC Scalable Core Code
This register contains the FBDC Configuration Code
This register contains the FBDC Changelist Code
This register contains the common control signals for FBDC
Defines the Constant Color-0 value to be used for the FBDC

bitfield.description: Defines the Constant Color-0 value to be used for the FBDC

register.description: Defines the Constant Color-1 value to be used for the FBDC

bitfield.description: Defines the Constant Color-1 value to be used for the FBDC

register.description: Connections of various sub-modules within DISPC, as well as some peripherals outside. One hot encoding

bitfield.description: Defines the connection to VIRTUAL_VP output
Defines the connection to WB pipe
Defines the connection to DPI-1 output.
Defines the connection to DPI-0 output.

register.description: This register controls the Merge_Split_Sync operation for VP1
This register controls the Merge_Split_Sync operation for VP3
This register configures the DMA buffer size allocated to the different threads - Shared memory feature

bitfield.description: Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to WB THREAD4.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n.
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP3 THREAD3.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n.
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP2 THREAD2.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n.
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP1 THREAD1.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n.
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP0 THREAD0.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n.

register.description: This register read the synchronized value of DMA buffer size allocated to the different threads - Shared memory feature
